page.title: 08HISTORY IN BURSCOUGH 2
page.content: The oldest church in Burscough is probably St Johns C E built in 1832. It has a school (infants and juniors) built in 1836. Until Priory High Secondary School was built in the late 1950's, St Johns also had senior classes. Burscough also has a Methodist Chapel and school,about the same age as St Johns. Thresher (wine merchants since 1847), although not established locally, is the oldest firm in the village. Other long established businesses include:Eastwoods who have sold and repaired footwear since 1890. Many shops and businesses have closed or changed, including storehouses and factories,2 of which made cakes.
